de.polygonal.ds.Array2

type
class
implements
Collection<T>
A two-dimensional array.

Constructor

new(w : Int, h : Int)
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError Invalid width or height (if debug flag is set).
Creates a two-dimensional array with width w and height h (minimum size is 2x2).

Instance Methods

appendCol(input : Array<T>) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError input is null or too small (if debug flag is set).
Appends the values stored in input in the range [0,getH()] by adding a new column.

appendRow(input : Array<T>) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError input is null or too small (if debug flag is set).
Appends the values stored in input in the range [0,getW()] by adding a new row.

assign(x : Dynamic, ?args : Array<Dynamic>) : Void

parameters
x If x is a class reference, the two-dimensional array is filled with instances of the specified class and the args parameter is used to pass additional constructor arguments. If x is an object or a primitive value, the object reference or the value of x is assigned instead.
Assigns new content to the two-dimensional array by replacing elements with x.

clear() : Void

Clears all elements by creating a new underlying array.

clone(assign : Bool, ?copier : T -> T) : Collection<T>

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError copier is null: element is not of type Cloneable (if debug flag is set).
Duplicates this two-dimensional array.
If assign is true the copier parameter is ignored and primitive elements are copied by value whereas objects are copied by reference. If assign is false and copier is null, the method assumes that all elements implement the Cloneable interface. In this case element.clone() is used for duplicating an element. Otherwise the method uses the copier function.

contains(x : T) : Bool

Returns true if this two-dimensional array contains the element x.

get(x : Int, y : Int) : T

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError Index out of range (if debug flag is set).
Returns the element stored at column x and row y.

getArray() : Array<T>

Grants access to the array storing the values of the two-dimensional array. Useful for advanced low-level operations.

getCol(x : Int, output : Array<T>) : Array<T>

returns
The output array.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError Index out of range or output is null (if debug flag is set).
Pushes the values stored in the column x to output.

getH() : Int

The height (#rows).

getRow(y : Int, output : Array<T>) : Array<T>

returns
The output array.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError Index out of range or output is null (if debug flag is set).
Pushes the values stored in the row y to output.

getW() : Int

The width (#columns).

isEmpty() : Bool

Always returns false.

iterator() : Iterator<T>

Iterates over all elements in this two-dimensional array.

prependCol(input : Array<T>) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError input is null or too small (if debug flag is set).
Prepends the values stored in input in the range [0,getH()] by adding a new column.

prependRow(input : Array<T>) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError input is null or too small (if debug flag is set).
Prepends the values stored in input in the range [0,getW()] by adding a new row.

resize(w : Int, h : Int) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError Invalid dimensions (if debug flag is set).
Sets the width w and height h of the two-dimensional array (minimum size is 2x2). If the new size is smaller than the existing size, elements are lost because of truncation.

set(x : Int, y : Int, val : T) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError Index out of range (if debug flag is set).
Writes x to the cell at column x and row y.

setCol(x : Int, input : Array<T>) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError Index out of range or input is null or insufficient input values (if debug flag is set).
Copies the values from input in the range [0,getH()] to the column at index x. This overwrites existing elements.

setH(x : Int) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError Invalid height (if debug flag is set).
Sets a new height. The minimum value is 2.

setRow(y : Int, input : Array<T>) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError Index out of range or input is null or insufficient input values (if debug flag is set).
Copies the values from input in the range [0,getW()] to the row at index y. This overwrites existing elements.

setW(x : Int) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError Invalid width (if debug flag is set).
Sets a new width. The minimum value is 2.

shiftE() : Void

Moves all columns by one column to the right. Columns are wrapped, so the column at the last index is not lost but appended to the leftmost column.

shiftN() : Void

Moves all rows up by one row. Rows are wrapped, so the first row is not lost but appended to the bottommost row.

shiftS() : Void

Moves all rows down by one row. Rows are wrapped, so the last row is not lost but appended to the topmost row.

shiftW() : Void

Moves all columns by one column to the left. Columns are wrapped, so the column at index 0 is not lost but appended to the rightmost column.

shuffle(?rval : Vector<Float>) : Void

parameters
rval A list of random double values in the range between 0 (inclusive) to 1 (exclusive).
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError rval is null or insufficient random values (if debug flag is set).
Shuffles the elements of this two-dimensional array using the Fisher-Yates algorithm. If rval is not given, Math.random() is used, otherwise random values are taken from the specified rval array.

size() : Int

The total size of this two-dimensional array, equals getW()*getH().

swap(x0 : Int, y0 : Int, x1 : Int, y1 : Int) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError Index out of range or x0,y0 equals x1,y1 (if debug flag is set).
Swaps the element stored at x0,y0 with the element stored at x1,y1.

toArray(?output : Array<T>) : Array<T>

returns
The output array or a new array if output was not specified.
Pushes all elements to the output array row by row. The method creates a new array if output is not specified.

toString() : String

Returns a string representing the current object. Prints out all elements if compiled with the -debug flag.
Example: 
	  var array2 = new de.polygonal.ds.Array2<String>(4, 4);
	  array2.walk(function(val:String, x:Int, y:Int):String { return Std.string(x) + '.' + Std.string(y); });
	  trace(array2); //output:

	  {Array2, 4x4}
	  |<
	    [0.0][1.0][2.0][3.0]
	    [0.1][1.1][2.1][3.1]
	    [0.2][1.2][2.2][3.2]
	    [0.3][1.3][2.3][3.3]
	  >|

toVector(?output : Vector<T>) : Vector<T>

returns
The output vector or a new vector if output was not specified.
Pushes all elements to the output vector row by row. The method creates a new vector if output is not specified.

transpose() : Void

Transposes the two-dimensional array.

walk(process : T -> Int -> Int -> T) : Void

Invokes the specified process function on each element. The function signature is: process(oldValue, x-index, y-index):newValue
